summary: This is probably wrong but I always assumed that the reason Venom never set off Peter’s spidey sense was because he had the...
body: This is probably wrong but I always assumed that the reason Venom never set off Peter’s spidey sense was because he had the symbiote for awhile, does that mean that he should be able to sense this Venom or was I wrong about the reason?

summary: So I bought an Art Deco captain America print for my game room in the new flat I’m moving into this Thursday and I’m real...
body:
So I bought an Art Deco captain America print for my game room in the new flat I’m moving into this Thursday and I’m real frickin excited.

Also found out there are iron man, spider man and hulk ones. Like. Yes. ✨✨✨

summary: It’s funny how everyone bitched about the MCU essentially turning Spider-Man’s suit into the Iron Man suit, yet they did the...

blog.name: spider-boiii
blog.title: PeTeR kNoWs SpIdErMan
blog.description: Clare/18/Just a moron who loves Spiderman. If @ah-beans-man follows you that is she and she is me

summary:
Based on the ask @parkrstark got because I got a random burst of creativity
———————-
Peter had walked into the lab expecting to...
body:
Based on the ask @parkrstark got because I got a random burst of creativity

———————-

Peter had walked into the lab expecting to see Tony. Well no not exactly, He had expected to see Pepper considering Tony had been in Europe handling an Avengers issue, but he had expected Tony to at least be on the phone. What he dint expect was to find Pepper like this, with her back turned to him, shaking.

“Pepper?”

She immediately straightened her back upon hearing his voice, she turned around trying to look as calm as possible, but Peter saw the way her eyes were puffier than usual and the tears still sliding down her face. Peters heart immediately began to race, he knew this wasn’t an update on his suit.

“Why don’t you sit down”

Peter approached the chair in front of him as though at any moment it could jump at him. With every step Peter’s heart rate increased. He knew the news wasn’t going to be good, he tried to run through every possible scenario, praying it wasn’t the one he was avoiding.

Finally Pepper spoke again, after attempting to compose herself.

“I-it’s Tony

H-he’s

Gone”

“Gone? What do you mean gone?”

“D-dead”

Pepper broke down. She quickly excused herself from the room giving Peter no further detail, he didn’t need it. He knew he should go after her and attempt to show her comfort or support but he couldn’t. He couldn’t do anything but sit there. He recognized the feelings in his stomach and throat but he didn’t want to. He was sick of this. Sick of finally finding someone and almost immediately losing them. He could feel hot tears welling up in his eyes. He clenched his teeth and balled his fists. He couldn’t do it again. Peter kicked over the chair he had been sitting on. He walked over to the counter where just days ago him and his mentor were working on a formula for his web serum. There was still a scrap of paper with a basis formula written by Tony. Peter couldn’t stand the sight of it, of Tonys handwriting, he ripped it up. Everything in the lab was making Peter more and more frustrated, everything was reminding him of the third father figure he had lost in his life. He was sick of losing everything he loved. He ran out of the lab and out of the tower. On his way out Happy had tried to slow him down insisting on giving him a ride but Peter couldn’t concentrate on that or anything in that god damn tower.

He ran all the way back to his apartment where he found the suit lying on his bed, the suit made for him by- he couldn’t bring himself to even think the name, he took the suit and threw it out the door. When he returned to his room he turned to his bulletin board, filled with pictures and mementos from the man he lost. Peter immediately began pulling and ripping and throwing into the trash until the wall was clean of evidence of the mans existence.

After that Peter looked into the mirror. His eyes weren’t drawn to his red nose and cheeks or the tear lines running down his face, they were drawn to his curls. The curls Mr Stark loved running his hands through when Spider-man had done an exceptionally good job or when Peter was having a panic attack, Mr Stark knew just how to calm him down. But Mr Stark wasn’t here anymore, and Peter was sick of the reminders of him. He found a pair of scissors on his desk and raised them to his hairline. He began to snip every last curl away, soon he had only a thin layer of hair on his head and one clump of curl remaining. He shakily brought the scissors to his head but at the last minute dropped them. Peter collapsed onto the floor and leg himself sob. Sob for his father and mother for his lost uncle and his mentor. He couldn’t wrap his mind around all that was happening, all the thoughts racing through his mind. The only thing he knew was his hands around his head and his knees on the floor. He wanted-needed to push everything else out.

Peter could no longer tell the time when he heard the keys clicking frantically and the door swinging open. Feet were racing towards his room. May.

“Peter I saw on the news. How are yo-“

She was cut off by seeing the teenager huddled on the floor surrounded by hair and practically drenched in sweat and tears. His big red eyes looked up to her. Peter knee he looked pathetic but he couldn’t help it. His life was crumbling around him. Nothing mattered.

May crouched down and wrapped her arms around him pulling him into a hug. They sat like that for hours in silence. With Peter sobbing into May like she was the only thing left in existence to hold onto. When May finally released him she cupped his face into her hands and looked at his puffy red face.

“Peter, I don’t have to tell you life is hard. When you think you’re standing on solid ground another rug gets pulled out from under your feet and you have to start over again. But if I can tell you one things it’s that this,” May motioned around the room at the carnage of Peters outburst, “isn’t the answer. Destroying every evidence of the person won’t make the pain go away. Trust me I’ve tried. What we need to do is think about what Tony would want. He would want you to move on. And you can’t do that immediately but destroying everything that reminds you of him is only going to hold you back. You understand?”

Peter nodded. May kisses him on the forehead and then twisted his last curl around her finger while clicking her tongue.

“And sweetie lets leave haircuts to the professionals from now on okay?”

Peter tried to crack a smile but it came out weak and defeated. May placed another kiss on his forehead.

“Do you need some time alone?”

Peter nodded slowly. When May left he got up and walked to his trash can. There was a photo of him and Tony on top, surprisingly not ripped. Peter picked it up held it in his hands for a couple minutes, letting tears run down his face. He pinned it back up on his wall and proceeded to go through the rest on the trash.

May was right. Tony wanted Peter to move on, but it didn’t come easily. In fact it took almost 2 years, but eventually Peter was able to think about the time he had with his mentor and smile at all the thing he had taught him. And even the worst times brought a smile to Peters face.

Peter could no longer tell the time when he heard the keys clicking frantically and the door swinging open. Feet were racing towards his room. May.

“Peter I saw on the news. How are yo-“

She was cut off by seeing the teenager huddled on the floor surrounded by hair and practically drenched in sweat and tears. His big red eyes looked up to her. Peter knee he looked pathetic but he couldn’t help it. His life was crumbling around him. Nothing mattered.

May crouched down and wrapped her arms around him pulling him into a hug. They sat like that for hours in silence. With Peter sobbing into May like she was the only thing left in existence to hold onto. When May finally released him she cupped his face into her hands and looked at his puffy red face.

“Peter, I don’t have to tell you life is hard. When you think you’re standing on solid ground another rug gets pulled out from under your feet and you have to start over again. But if I can tell you one things it’s that this,” May motioned around the room at the carnage of Peters outburst, “isn’t the answer. Destroying every evidence of the person won’t make the pain go away. Trust me I’ve tried. What we need to do is think about what Tony would want. He would want you to move on. And you can’t do that immediately but destroying everything that reminds you of him is only going to hold you back. You understand?”

Peter nodded. May kisses him on the forehead and then twisted his last curl around her finger while clicking her tongue.

“And sweetie lets leave haircuts to the professionals from now on okay?”

Peter tried to crack a smile but it came out weak and defeated. May placed another kiss on his forehead.

“Do you need some time alone?”

Peter nodded slowly. When May left he got up and walked to his trash can. There was a photo of him and Tony on top, surprisingly not ripped. Peter picked it up held it in his hands for a couple minutes, letting tears run down his face. He pinned it back up on his wall and proceeded to go through the rest on the trash.

May was right. Tony wanted Peter to move on, but it didn’t come easily. In fact it took almost 2 years, but eventually Peter was able to think about the time he had with his mentor and smile at all the thing he had taught him. And even the worst times brought a smile to Peters face.

summary: I know Spiderman’s gotta have a job that means he’s constantly living in a shitty apartment forced to take posed pictures of...
body:
I know Spiderman’s gotta have a job that means he’s constantly living in a shitty apartment forced to take posed pictures of himself, but come on

How long can you feasibly work long term at a newspaper that’s supposed to be about nothing but one of the absolute worst brass instruments out there yet never publishes a single story on them and opts instead to bash a guy running aorund in blue and red spandex
